result.markdown:
# Get map data {#sec-chap012} ::::: {#obj-chap012} :::: {.my-objectives} ::: {.my-objectives-header} Objectives ::: ::: {.my-objectives-container} Download map data from Natural Earth. ::: :::: ::::: With {**rnaturalearth**} there is a special package for downloading the geometries of all the countries in the world. I will take the medium scale ('50') of the 'physical' category. The data source is [Natural Earth](https://www.naturalearthdata.com/). I downloaded original data from Natural Earth with `rnaturalearth::ne_download()` and compared it with the pre-downloaded data from the `rnaturalearth::ne_countries()`. It turned out that they are essentially identical. So I used the pre-downloaded data with the advantage that the resulting files have not converted from `.shp` files to a {**sf**} file. :::::{.my-r-code} :::{.my-r-code-header} :::::: {#cnj-012-get-map-data} : Get map data from Natural Earth :::::: ::: ::::{.my-r-code-container}
**Run this code chunk manually if the file(s) still needs to be downloaded.**
::: {#lst-012-get-map-data} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} raw_countries <- rnaturalearth::ne_countries( scale = "medium", type = "countries", continent = NULL, country = NULL, geounit = NULL, sovereignty = NULL, returnclass = "sf" ) my_save_data_file("chap012", raw_countries, "raw_countries.rds") ``` ::: Get map data from Natural Earth ::: :::: ::::: ## Glossary Entries {.unnumbered} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
term definition
Natural Earth Natural Earth is a public domain map dataset available at 1:10m, 1:50m, and 1:110 million scales. Featuring tightly integrated vector and raster data, with Natural Earth you can make a variety of visually pleasing, well-crafted maps with cartography or GIS software (https://www.naturalearthdata.com/).
